intro: Ageratum platypodum, commonly known as the flatpod ageratum, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically blue, violet, or white in color. Ageratum platypodum is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its compact growth habit and vibrant blooms. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil.
